text:
Located in Rong Fa Coffee Shop.

Price: $4.50 (Lei Cha Brown Rice)

The ingredients of the Lei Cha (Thunder Tea Rice) includes fried bean curd, sweet chye poh (preserved radish bits), long beans, stir fried cabbage, mani cai (sweet leaf), chye sim, toasted peanuts and ikan bilis (dried anchovies). Tea soup is basil based and is quite savoury.

Loved the addition of the ikan bilis which provides more crunch and savouriness.

Came at around 12 and was served immediately.

Do come support the lesser known dishes in Singapore!
The rice portion is ok but why the soup portion come with so little, is it need to add hot water our self ? But the taste is ok without adding hot water
One of the most authentic Lei Cha around, thick and fragrant soup base, close to the taste in Johor Kulai.

great thunder tea rice with brown rice option for a very affordable price. their sauce is not the watery type and is more thick and tasty. it’s like having Chinese Pesto. do add on their Zhai Er (斋鹅) which is also super crispy.
Used to be a regular. But Auntie has abit of attitude problem and hence I will not patronise this stall ever. On a side note, stall also sell economic bee hoon which is not nice and pricey.
